message.body: yeah, thought it looked interesting
basically a facilities position, but worth looking into. I suppose I could ask Darryl how he got into property management
oh is that what he does?
yeah, it would be a good starting point
better then what I'm doing right now
he manages a condos in phily
its all about making small steps
and every now and then you get lucky with big steps
like Maybe Darryl could jumpstart us on a much bigger step
If we could get property maintence contract, we could have our friends/community members people work for us
I'm probably going to be away to do cable for a while, but I'd like to see if we can get a crew together and maybe secure something
and then we would be way more legit, thats what most communities that are legit have
there was a grasscut service for pre-foreclosure properties that paid $45 or so a lawn
doesn't seem like much, but if you knock out 8-10 a day that's some pretty big $$$
but you'd need a crew to do that. Pay em like $12/hr and your still making out well
yeah!
That's big
I'd be down to do that
I'd invest in a trailer and some lawn equipment, probably 3 grand or so
main thing is it has to be steady, and that's what I have trouble with
hmmm
oh, what do you mean? Like steady pay
steady work
if you can get a contract, then youre golden
yeah, I guess during the off time it would be unsteady
like the valet waste service
but during the summer it'd be pretty steady
yeah
bc then you have more control
and it's interchangable
but you get people in the coop, where money isnt as important, and they are more willing to work on the side here and there
getting away from having to work all the time is part of what the coop is all about
exactly
when I get back, if we could get josh in on it, and you and kristin quit your jobs, we'd have a quite a team assembled
where work is more about doing what you love, what inspires you
well, it
it's still about paying the bills, but more on your terms and not like a stress over money
sometimes you still have to do the work that is not as inspiring to have the time and ability to do the work that inspires you
like there is still a mortgage here, but it's more spread out
aka paying the bills with less work, so you can be free to create that what you want to create
yup
and each person can pursue the things they want
being the big fish should allow us that ability
like gardening, or coop store
but, we do have to be more organized if we do that
definately
*definitely
We came up with some ideas on how to spread out leadership or facilitation at meditation
I like it
that's good
the idea of not relying on one person to lead or faciliatate
I wish I could have been there
how was the beach?
beach was nice though, we had fun but we didn't leave intil like 2pm
I guess not that great
oh
wow thats late
Milena isn't the best at planning things
I tried to get her to pick me up but she refused, told me to meet at her place
then later she was like, "yeah, sorry I didn't pick you up. I guess it would have made more sense, but I was hung over and didn't feel like it"
haha
but hey, I scored 360 at skeeball and won a free t-shirt!
Everyone started clapping, I felt like a celebrity
wow
that's pretty good
pretty dam impressive
whats going on today
ok, I've got to run, let me know if there's anything to get into today, maybe we can have a coop meeting later today when Kristin gets home
ok
